abstract: Edgar Bronfman Jr. will no longer lead the board of the company, effective Jan. 31. He had been chief executive until August, shortly after Warner Music was bought by Access Industries for $3.3 billion.
snippet: Edgar Bronfman Jr. will no longer lead the board of the company, effective Jan. 31. He had been chief executive until August, shortly after Warner Music was bought by Access Industries for $3.3 billion.
lead_paragraph: 8:48 p.m. | Updated  Edgar M. Bronfman Jr., who has been a top executive in the music industry since the mid-1990s, is stepping down as chairman of the Warner Music Group.

headline.main: Bronfman Is Stepping Down as Warner Music Chairman
